alert.note: Alert for Pike (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:43AM EST until February 20 at 12:08PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams, Brown, Highland, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1243 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Maysville, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Georgetown, Waverly, Wheelersburg, Washington, Mount Orab, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Manchester, Peebles, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Lynchburg and Leesburg.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
